metadata.description_of_the_collection: Describe which science question this collection is about

diagnostic.method: Zonal root mean square error of equatorial_pacific sst, time series are linearly detrended, observations and model regridded to generic_1x1deg
diagnostic.name: sst Zonal RMSE
diagnostic.ref: Using CDAT regridding and rms (uncentered and biased) calculation

metric.method: The metric is the statistical value between the model and the observations
metric.name: BiasSstLonRmse

diagnostic.method: Standard deviation of nino3.4 sstA, time series are linearly detrended
diagnostic.name: ENSO amplitude

metric.method: The metric is the absolute value of the relative difference between model and observations values (M = 100 * abs[[model-obs] / obs])
metric.name: EnsoAmpl

diagnostic.method: nino3.4 SSTA during DEC regressed against nino3.4 SSTA during 6 years (centered on ENSO), the duration is the number of consecutive months during which the regression is above 0.25, time series are linearly detrended, smoothing using a triangle shaped window of 5 points
diagnostic.name: ENSO Duration based on life cyle SSTA pattern

metric.method: The metric is the absolute value of the relative difference between model and observations values (M = 100 * abs[[model-obs] / obs])
metric.name: EnsoDuration

diagnostic.method: Ratio between NDJ and MAM standard deviation nino3.4 sstA, time series are linearly detrended
diagnostic.name: ENSO seasonality

metric.method: The metric is the absolute value of the relative difference between model and observations values (M = 100 * abs[[model-obs] / obs])
metric.name: EnsoSeasonality

diagnostic.method: Nino (Nina) events = nino3.4 sstA > 0.75 (< -0.75) during DEC, zonal SSTA (meridional averaged [-5.0 ; 5.0]), the zonal SSTA maximum (minimum) is located for each event, the diversity is the interquartile range (IQR = Q3 - Q1), time series are linearly detrended, smoothing using a triangle shaped window of 5 points
diagnostic.name: ENSO Diversity (interquartile range)

metric.method: The metric is the absolute value of the relative difference between model and observations values (M = 100 * abs[[model-obs] / obs])
metric.name: EnsoSstDiversity

diagnostic.method: nino3.4 SSTA during DEC regressed against equatorial_pacific SSTA, time series are linearly detrended, smoothing using a triangle shaped window of 5 points, observations and model regridded to generic_1x1deg
diagnostic.name: ENSO Zonal SSTA pattern
diagnostic.ref: Using CDAT regridding and rms (uncentered and biased) calculation

metric.method: The metric is the statistical value between the model and the observations
metric.name: EnsoSstLonRmse

diagnostic.method: Standard deviation of nino3.4 sstA, time series are linearly detrended
diagnostic.name: ENSO skewness

metric.method: The metric is the absolute value of the relative difference between model and observations values (M = 100 * abs[[model-obs] / obs])
metric.name: EnsoSstSkew

diagnostic.method: nino3.4 SSTA during DEC regressed against nino3.4 SSTA during 6 years (centered on ENSO), time series are linearly detrended, smoothing using a triangle shaped window of 5 points
diagnostic.name: ENSO life cyle SSTA pattern
diagnostic.ref: Using CDAT regridding and rms (uncentered and biased) calculation

metric.method: The metric is the statistical value between the model and the observations
metric.name: EnsoSstTsRmse

diagnostic.method: Zonal root mean square error of equatorial_pacific climatological sst STD, time series are linearly detrended, observations and model regridded to generic_1x1deg
diagnostic.name: sst zonal seasonality RMSE
diagnostic.ref: Using CDAT regridding and rms (uncentered and biased) calculation

metric.method: The metric is the statistical value between the model and the observations
metric.name: SeasonalSstLonRmse

metadata.name: Metrics Collection for ENSO performance
